article_title: Driver killed, two passengers injured in Garland car crash
article_text:
A car crash killed a driver and injured two passengers in Garland Sunday morning.

Garland police say the car was heading west on Interstate 635 near Jupiter Road around 5:30 a.m. when it spun clockwise and collided with a light pole. Police say the highway was not wet when the crash occurred.

Moses Johnson, 21, died at the scene, police spokesman Mike Hatfield said. Two passengers, an 18-year-old man and 21-year-old man, were taken to Baylor University Medical Center of Dallas with serious injuries. The passengers’ names were not released.

Police are investigating whether high speed and alcohol were factors in the crash, Hatfield said.
